summary: This is a standard Office of the Inspector General (OIG) form used to document warnings and assurances given to an employee being asked to provide information voluntarily as part of an investigation into 'Job performance failure and security failure.' It includes a waiver section for the employee to sign, acknowledging the voluntary nature of the interview.
keyFacts: The document is a voluntary interview form from the U.S. Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General (OIG).
The OIG investigation pertains to 'Job performance failure and security failure.'
The form warns that statements provided may be used in future criminal or disciplinary proceedings.
The form includes a waiver for the employee to sign, confirming the interview is voluntary and no coercion was used.
No specific individuals, events, or locations related to the Epstein case are mentioned in this excerpt.
